description: 1 x London plane (T1):  - Reduce height by 2 - 2.5 m, and the crown spread to the west by 2.5 - 3 m and to the north, east and south by 1.5 - 2 m.1 x London plane (T2): - Reduce height by 2 - 2.5 m, and the crown spread to the north, east, south and west by 2 - 2.5 m. 1 x London plane (T3): - Reduce height by 2 - 2.5 m, and the crown spread to the north by 2.5 - 3 m and to the east, south and west by 1.5 - 2 m.1 x London plane (T4): - Reduce height by 2 - 2.5 m, and the crown spread to the north and east by 2.5 - 3 m and to the south and west by 1.5 - 2 m. 1 x Norway maple (T5):  Reduce height by 2 m, and the crown spread to the north, east and west by 2 m, and to the south by up to 1 m.1 x London plane (T6): Reduce crown by removing regrowth of approximately 2 m in length back to the most recent pruning points.1 x yew (T7): - Reduce crown by reducing the crown spread to the southeast by 1.5 m and to the north and west by 1 m.1 x lime (T8): - Reduce crown by reducing the crown spread to the north, east, south and west by around 1.5 m. - Lift low canopy - Specified extent to 3.5 m (whole crown).1 x ash (T9): Fell 1 x Leyland cypress (T10): Fell1 x London plane (T12):  Prune from adjacent structure to clear building by 2.5 m. - Reduce height by 2 - 2.5 m, and the crown spread to the north, east and west by 2.5 - 3 m and to the south by 2 - 2.5 m. 1 x London Plane (T14): Reduce the height by 2 - 2.5 m, and the crown spread to the east, south and west by 2.5 - 3 m and to the north by 2 - 2.5 m. - End-weight reduction - Specified extent of the subordinate stem to the northwest over the road at 12 m, by 3 - 3.5 m. 1 x ash (T15): - Prune from adjacent structure to clear the lamp column by 2 m. The limb at 6 m is causing an ongoing interference with the lamp post, requiring regular reduction work. Reduce the limb by 4 m to the north facing secondary branch attached 2 m from the limb union to clear the lamp column and prevent regular crown conflict.
